titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I worked most part of the day at the All Souls Sermon, but made strangely little progress.
I received a letter from Gilbert Simpson announcing the birth of his son

, & asking me to be the boy's Godfather. This request I refused as I am barred by my "spiritual affinity" to Gilbert himself. It would hardly be permitted by the canons that the same man should be Godfather of a father and a son! The Chancellor of the Exchequer made a surprisingly optimistic speech in the House last night. He even said that he saw no necessity for additional taxation next year. But this seems too good to be true.
